member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.Accounts.Save(AbstractAccountApi.IAccount,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Saves an account to smartschool. This can be used to create a new user as well as update an existing user, but the account values must be complete. Also a new password must be provided. There are other methods to do a partial user update.
member.param: The account to send to smartschool.
The new password for the user.
The password for the first co-account. This is optional and will not change the password if empty.
The password for the second co-account. This is option ald will not change the password if empty.
member.returns: Returns true on success. False when the transaction fails. When false, an error will be logged.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.Accounts.Load(AbstractAccountApi.IAccount)
member.summary: Load account details from smartschool. The account must have a valid UID to begin with. All other values will be overwritten.
member.returns: Returns false when failed. Errors will be added to the log object.

member.name: T:SmartschoolApi.Error
member.summary: Smartschool has a table with error messages. When an error occurs, the error code can be converted to a message using this table. This means the table has to be loaded first (GetCodes). Once loaded, this class can be used to add message to the log. The log object itself is passed as an argument when the Init method on the Connector is called.

member.name: F:SmartschoolApi.Error.errorCodes
member.summary: A json list of all error codes

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.Error.GetCodes
member.summary: Loads the error codes from smartschool and saves them in the errorCodes object. When the list with errorCodes is alread loaded, nothing will happen.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.Error.ToString(System.Int32)
member.summary: Convert an error code to its string value.
member.returns: A string explanation of the error. Or 'Invalid Error' when the code is not known.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.Error.AddError(System.Int32)
member.summary: Add an error to the Log object about the provided error code.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.Error.AddError(System.String)
member.summary: Add a string Error message to the Log object.
member.param: The text to add as error.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.Error.AddMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Add a string message to the Log object.
member.param: The text to add as message.

member.name: T:SmartschoolApi.Group
member.summary: A Smartschool account group. Groups can have have Child groups, Accounts and group properties.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.Group.#ctor(AbstractAccountApi.IGroup)
member.summary: Creates a Smartschool group. Parent can be null if this is the main group.
member.param: The Parent group. Can be null.

member.name: P:SmartschoolApi.Group.Name
member.summary: The Name of the group

member.name: P:SmartschoolApi.Group.Description
member.summary: The group description

member.name: P:SmartschoolApi.Group.Type
member.summary: The group type. Can be Group, Class or Invalid.

member.name: P:SmartschoolApi.Group.Visible
member.summary: If the group is visible for normal users.

member.name: P:SmartschoolApi.Group.Official
member.summary: Wether or not this group is an official group. Official groups are classes with students. Official groups need to have an AdminNumber and InstituteNumber.

member.name: P:SmartschoolApi.Group.CoAccountLabel
member.summary: The name co-accounts will see for this group. This value is optional.

member.name: P:SmartschoolApi.Group.AdminNumber
member.summary: Administative numbers are also present in Wisa. Every study domain has its own number and must be added to official groups.

member.name: P:SmartschoolApi.Group.InstituteNumber
member.summary: Institute Number. Must be added for official groups. It's a normal numeric value, but the code must exist in smartschool. If not, the entry will be rejected.

member.name: P:SmartschoolApi.Group.Titulars
member.summary: The (co-)titulars in a list of strings. Because of limitations by smartschool this field cannot be saved right now.

member.name: P:SmartschoolApi.Group.Children
member.summary: The child groups in this group.

member.name: P:SmartschoolApi.Group.Accounts
member.summary: The accounts in this group.

member.name: P:SmartschoolApi.Group.Parent
member.summary: The parent group. Groups at level 0 have no parent and this will return null.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.Group.Find(System.String)
member.summary: Find a group by its name. Subgroups will also be searched, unless this group is added to the list with discarded subgroups in the Connector.
member.returns: The group with this name, or null if not found.

member.name: P:SmartschoolApi.Group.CountClassGroupsOnly
member.summary: Get the number of official groups (Classes) within this group. If this group is in the list with DiscardedSubgroups, subgroups will not be evaluated.

member.name: P:SmartschoolApi.Group.Count
member.summary: Get the number of groups (Classes) within this group. If this group is in the list with DiscardedSubgroups, subgroups will not be evaluated.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.Group.NumAccounts
member.summary: Counts the number of accounts in this group and all its subgroups. If this group is present in the list Connector.DiscardSubgroups, the child groups will not be evaluated.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.Group.Sort
member.summary: Sort all child groups by name. This is a recursive method.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.Group.GetTreeAsList(System.Collections.Generic.List{AbstractAccountApi.IGroup})
member.summary: Get all child groups as a list. This is a recursive method.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.Group.LoadAccounts
member.summary: Loads the accounts in this group from smartschool. This method is NOT recursive.

member.name: T:SmartschoolApi.GroupManager
member.summary: Manager for Groups in Smartschool. Groups are stored in an object tree. The root of this tree is not a real object, but a container for all the groups in the main level of smartschool.

member.name: P:SmartschoolApi.GroupManager.Root
member.summary: The root of the Group object tree. Will be null if no accounts are loaded.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.GroupManager.Load
member.summary: Load all Groups from smartschool. This method will not reload if groups are already present. If a reload is needed, use the reload method.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.GroupManager.Count(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Counts the groups in the tree.
member.param: If true, only official groups (classes) will be included.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.GroupManager.Reload
member.summary: Reload the whole group object tree. The tree will be sorted when ready.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.GroupManager.GetLogicalParent(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to determine what the logical parent should be for a class group. This works by evaluating the first character in the provided string, which should be a number, indicating the year for this class. The method takes the current Smartschool configuration into account. Meaning that if only grades and no years are configured, the logical parent should be the grade group. If years are configured, the logical parent for a class should be a year. If none are configured, the logical parent should be the path for all classes.
member.param: The name of the group, should start with a number.
member.returns: The name of the logical parent.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.GroupManager.Save(AbstractAccountApi.IGroup)
member.summary: Save the group to smartschool. This will save the group's name, description, group code, parent group code, untis ID, (institute number and administrative number for official groups). Please note that smartschool does not accept groups without a description.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.GroupManager.Delete(AbstractAccountApi.IGroup)
member.summary: Deletes the group from smartschool.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.GroupManager.MoveUserToClass(AbstractAccountApi.IAccount,AbstractAccountApi.IGroup,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Moves a student to another official class. The group must be an official group with GroupType.Class. The date provided is very important, because this is an official class change. Changes to the student's evaluation will look at the date of this change.
member.param: The official date of this change.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.GroupManager.AddUserToGroup(AbstractAccountApi.IAccount,AbstractAccountApi.IGroup)
member.summary: Adds a user to a group. The target group cannot be an official group. To move a student to a new official group, the MoveUserToClass method should be used.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.GroupManager.RemoveUserFromGroup(AbstractAccountApi.IAccount,AbstractAccountApi.IGroup)
member.summary: Removes a user from a group. The group should not be an official group.
member.param: The group to remove the account from.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.Utils.DateToString(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Converts a Date to the String format expected by smartschool.
member.returns: A date string with format year-month-day

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.Utils.StringToDate(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a smartschool date string to a DateTime object.
member.returns: A DateTime object representing the same day.

member.name: M:SmartschoolApi.Utils.SameDay(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Checks if two DateTime objects refer to the same day. Year, Month and Day are evaluated, but differences in Hours and lower units are discarded.
member.returns: True, if Year, Month and Day are the same. Otherwise false.
